channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Covid infections continue alarming rise with 1,108 cases in last 24 hours
item.description: The nation's total number of cases has risen to 332,752 as data shows there are now an average of 1,173 new cases each day - a figure which has surged from 992 last Friday.

item.title: Thousands of anti-maskers who believe pandemic is a HOAX march against lockdown in London
item.description: Pictures from the demonstration show a large crowd gathered in the square - none of whom are wearing masks - holding signs that brand the pandemic as a 'hoax'.

item.title: Wildlife expert warns rural UK is home to 250 black leopards and 250 pumas
item.description: Dr Andrew Hemmings, of the Royal Agricultural University in Cirencester, believes around 80 per cent of reports he received of 'big cats' in the British countryside are credible.

item.title: Brighton welcome 2,524 socially distanced supporters for a friendly against Chelsea
item.description: Fans were made to keep a seat between them as they gathered at the Amex Stadium n Brighton for Saturday's friendly, which ended in a 1-1 draw.

item.title: Six workers at Mr Kipling bakery test positive for Covid and are sent home to isolate
item.description: Six workers at a Mr Kipling bakery in Trent Vale, Stoke-on-Trent, have tested positive for coronavirus, owner Premier Foods confirmed. The site remains open and the staff are self-isolating.

item.title: Priti Patel warns illegal rave organisers 'you are NOT above the law' ahead of bank holiday weekend
item.description: The Home Secretary has lashed out at the organisers of illegal raves, warning them they are 'not above the law' and described illegal revellers' behaviour as 'breathtakingly selfish'.

item.title: Blue star Lee Ryan is banned from driving for six months
item.description: Pop star Lee Ryan, of Twickenham in west London, has been disqualified from driving for six months, fined £120 and told to pay costs of £142 - totalling £262.

item.title: BBC is blasted for plugging ex-drug dealer's rap track amid Proms row over axing of Rule Brittania
item.description: The rapper, whose real name is Jamel Bousbaa, was sentenced to five years in prison in 2018 for running an operation to smuggle drugs out of London to the seaside town of Clacton, Essex.

item.title: Jenny Harries says face coverings evidence is 'not very strong'
item.description: Government guidance released late last night ahead of the return of children to classes next week said teachers and students may need to wear face coverings in communal areas.

item.title: Inferno tears through Spanish beach club popular with Britons after flames leap across motorway
item.description: A fire and thick smoke has engulfed the holiday destination of Laguna Village near Estepona, Spain. The blaze has affected a beach club favoured by British holidaymakers.

item.title: Revellers enjoy August bank holiday set to be coldest EVER as polar winds drag the mercury to 10C
item.description: Plummeting temperatures could make the bank holiday weekend one of the coldest on record, coming just days after the UK experienced record-breaking heat.

item.title: Birmingham police launch murder probe after man, 26, is gunned down in Stechford
item.description: Murtaza Nazit, 26, suffered a fatal gunshot wound during yesterday's shooting in the Stechford area of Birmingham at around 8pm on Friday, August 28.

item.title: British family who rented home to work in Qatar cannot return to UK due to Covid eviction ban
item.description: Emma Burton and her family are stuck at their parents home in France because the government's eviction ban means they can't kick the tenant out of their Newton-le-Willows, Merseyside home.

item.title: 'Stupid' Lloyds Bank customer adviser, 27, sold account details for £50 each to gambling addict
item.description: Jaspreet Marwaha, from Birmingham, gave the information of more than 80 accounts to Mohammed Saif Maqsood who swiped between £82,000 and £92,000 from them.

item.title: Rescuers dash to Dorset coast after cliff collapses sparking fears beachgoers are trapped
item.description: Tonnes of rock came crashing down onto the coast between Hive Beach and Freshwater Beach, Burton Bradstock, early Saturday morning.

item.title: Track-and-trace shambles as Border Force admits it spot checks fewer than a THIRD of arrivals
item.description: Border Force officers have been set a target of just 30 per cent for checking passenger paperwork on their arrival into the country as concerns are raised over the number of cases in Portugal

item.title: Macron warns France faces another national lockdown after 7,379 cases in 24 hours
item.description: The figures represented what the health ministry described as an exponential surge just days before millions of children are due to return to school for the first time in five months.

item.title: Detectives probing abduction of three young brothers arrest man, 31, in east London
item.description: An urgent manhunt remains under way for Imran Safi, 26, who is said to have snatched his sons Bilal, six, Ebrar, five, and three-year-old Yaseen Safi last Thursday.

item.title: Chadwick Boseman tears up in video as he recalls meeting young fans with terminal cancer
item.description: Black Panther's Chadwick Boseman recounted meeting two young fans with terminal cancer in a moving 2018 video, two years after he had gotten his own secret cancer diagnosis.

item.title: Odeon Leicester Square gives MailOnline an insight into the new Covid cinema experience
item.description: Cinema-goers in face masks are waiting in line to buy food and drink, and showing staff their tickets before taking their seats in the 800-capacity screen in Leicester Square, London.

item.title: Freedom snatched from Anni Dewani killer as he's sent back to jail on day he was due for release
item.description: Zola Tongo, 39, one of the men involved in the killing of honeymoon bride Anni Dewani who was due to walk free today has been ordered to stay behind bars just hours before he was due to be released.

item.title: Banksy-funded refugee rescue boat´s calls for help...
item.description: The captain of a Banksy-funded refugee rescue boat said it is stranded in the Mediterranean Sea and emergency calls for immediate help have been ignored.
item.media:description: The Louise Michel refugee rescue boat was funded by British street artist Banksy (Louise Michel/PA)

item.title: Prince Harry hosts a Zoom quiz to mark Rugby League's 125th birthday
item.description: The Duke of Sussex, 35, joined a virtual call alongside staff and volunteers from the Rugby Football League, hosting his first ever Zoom quiz during the appearance.

item.title: Britain needs a 'Nightingale moment' for school pupils, argues children's commissioner
item.description: Anne Longfield said more money would be needed to help schools as teachers rush to get their students to catch-up on five months of missed learning. She said the country risks losing 'a generation'.

item.title: New 'bullet' plane is revealed that aims to make private air travel as affordable as commercial
item.description: The first official information and images of the Celera 500L, an aircraft expected to revolutionize private air travel, were launched by Otto Aviation Wednesday

item.title: Man shot dead during BLM protests is seen on video taunting armed men and saying 'Shoot me, n*****'
item.description: Joseph Rosenbaum, 36, of Kenosha, Wisconsin, was fatally shot on Tuesday night during the unrest sparked by last Sunday's police shooting of 29-year-old black man Jacob Blake.

item.title: Berlin police break-up protest for failing to socially-distance
item.description: Berlin police moved to break up protesters that had failed to wear masks or socially distance as they marched by the Brandenburg gate. More than 18,000 attended.

item.title: BBC Radio 2 host Paul Gambaccini sues police after being arrested and falsely-accused of sex crimes
item.description: Paul Gambaccini, 71, was arrested in October 2013 as part of Operation Yewtree and spent a year on bail before the case was dropped.

item.title: Bloody scenes as Muslims flagellate themselves with chains and blades during procession in Peshawar
item.description: GRAPHIC CONTENT WARNING: Graphic photos have captured the scenes in Peshawar as Shiite Muslims flagellate themselves with chains and blades.

item.title: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry will spend 'an extended period of time in the UK next year'
item.description: Prince Harry, 35, and Meghan Markle, 39, are likely to spend an 'extended period of time in the UK next year' to attend the unveiling of the new Princess Diana statue, according to Omid Scobie.

item.title: Extinction Rebellion demonstrations get underway across the country after group promised bedlam
item.description: Multiple demonstrations are getting underway across the country this weekend as environmental campaign group Extinction Rebellion gears up for a new 'uprising'.

item.title: Chadwick Boseman: Denzel Washington honors Black Panther star after paying for his study at Oxford
item.description: Denzel Washington (left), 65, honored Chadwick Boseman as a 'gentle soul and brilliant artist' after it was revealed that the acting legend secretly paid for the Black Panther star to study acting at Oxford.

item.title: Russia holds major war games in the Bering Sea near Alaska
item.description: Russia's navy chief, Adm. Nikolai Yevmenov, said that more than 50 warships and about 40 aircraft were taking part in the exercise in the Bering Sea, which involved practice missile launches.

item.title: Former England striker Francis Jeffers gets 17-month road ban for refusing to take breathalyser
item.description: Everton under-23s coach Francis Jeffers told Merseyside Police he had drunk' just two bottles of lager' when they pulled him over for driving erratically in his Ford Fiesta.

item.title: How the West was lost: JOHN MICKLETHWAIT reveals coronavirus is making China all powerful again
item.description: JOHN MICKLETHWAIT: London has lost 6,000 people. In one four-week stretch in April, more Londoners died than during the worst four weeks of the Blitz.

item.title: Riots break out in Sweden as 300 people gather to protest against far-Right activists
item.description: Dramatic pictures show tyres being burnt in the street and a large plume of smoke rising above Malmo, in the south of the Scandinavian country.

item.title: Meghan Markle's mother starts a new job as a teacher showing students how to make hippy jewellery
item.description: Doria (pictured with Meghan), 63, who quit her post as a social worker at a mental health clinic after her daughter married into the Royal Family in 2018, is teaching at a community college in Los Angeles.

item.title: Woman, 28, who suffered a spinal fracture after a fall while out on a rural walk praises App
item.description: Laura Moreton, 28, from South Wales, has told how she used the what3words app to give the ambulance response unit her exact location after she realised her injury was something very serious.

item.title: I'm A Celebrity 2020: ITV boss reveals ALL stars for this year's series have already been confirmed
item.description: Amid rumours that Selling Sunset's Christine Quinn, presenter Vernon Kay, and Corrie's Beverley Callard have signed up, ITV's Kevin Lygo assures all of the as-yet-unnamed stars have been confirmed.

item.title: What would you do to get a bigger inheritance?
item.description: Only 55 per cent of adults plan to split their wealth equally among their children when they die, new findings from wealth management company Charles Stanley have revealed.

item.title: Celebrities face BAN on secretly air-brushing Instagram snaps that create 'warped view' of beauty
item.description: Tory MP Dr Luke Evans has drawn up a Bill which would mean celebrities would have to label images which have been digitally altered to change how they look.

item.title: Matt Hancock back tracks on return to work saying face-to-face contact is vital
item.description: The health secretary professed that it allows employees to build up a 'rapport' and is a 'natural part of getting things done'. But only last month he was extolling its 'virtues'.

item.title: Tokyo flying car firm becomes first company to lift vehicle several feet off ground
item.description: The Japanese-based SkyDrive project has successfully completed a four-minute test flight of its latest 'flying car'. The vehicle, carrying one test pilot, rose several feet into the air and hovered.

item.title: THIRTY wedding guests abandon British bride and groom tying the knot in Prague today
item.description: Oliver (right) and his fiancée Andrea (left) have already cancelled their wedding twice due to pregnancy, having become engaged four years ago.

item.title: Scotland in miniature: Things to do in the Isle of Arran, from wildlife tours to whisky tasting
item.description: The Daily Mail's Netia Walker visited the Isle of Arran with her husband and two daughters. They enjoyed discovering secluded picnic spots and secret lochs perfect for wild swimming.

item.title: BBC's taxpayer-funded offices sit empty with 'just 20% of staff'
item.description: Bartender Harrison Grant, 32, works in the Horse and Groom pub - a mere yards away from Broadcasting House in London. He said its profits are down by 80 per cent due to fewer BBC workers.

item.title: French-Italian director's footage of Victorians enjoying a day on the English coast
item.description: Remarkable new details about 'The Shrimp Fishermen' emerged following work that converted the grainy 50 second clip into high-resolution film using artificial intelligence.

item.title: Health Secretary Matt Hancock warns UK-wide restrictions could be reimposed this winter
item.description: Matt Hancock (pictured) said nationwide restrictions in the UK cannot be ruled out if coronavirus cases spike in the winter as a leaked government document warns of 81,000 deaths
item.media:description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock warned of extensive local lockdowns in the event of a second wave (Jonathan Brady/PA Wire)

item.title: The Queen is 'very keen for things to return to normal', sources tell Vanity Fair
item.description: The Queen, 94, is 'very keen for things to return to normal' and intends to attend Cenotaph in London in November, sources told Vanity Fair's Katie Nicholl.

item.title: The cheapest quarantine-free city breaks, from Lithuania's capital to Lisbon
item.description: A Post Office Travel Money report reveals 22 out of 24 surveyed cities (all on the quarantine exemption list) are cheaper than they were in March. Here's our guide to the best places to go.

item.title: Moment pervert fitness coach, 36, claims HE'S a paedophile hunter when confronted by vigilantes
item.description: John Wray, already a convicted sex offender, offered to take two 14-year-old girls shopping for 'underwear and bikinis' in sickening online chats.

item.title: Savvy mother-of-two surprises her brother by transforming drab and dated kitchen for just £150
item.description: Charlotte Tarry, 35, from Maidstone, overhauled her brother Ben's, 34, kitchen in just 24 hours with a strict budget of just £150. She posted the results on Facebook, with many people praising her effort.

item.title: Chadwick Boseman married Taylor Simone Ledward who with Black Panther star when he died of cancer
item.description: Taylor Simone Ledward was by his bedside in Los Angeles when he died alongside close family members. The couple have no children together, and were first seen together in 2015.

item.title: Cover your eyes kids... BBC weather map reveals unfortunately-shaped shower system
item.description: Twitter users in Essex were faced with a more comprehensive weather package last night after logging onto the app to check the county's rainfall.

item.title: Rota system could be used for secondary schools
item.description: Education Secretary Gavin Williamson said any changes to secondary school attendance `will only ever be an absolute last resort´.

item.title: Donald Trump's sister calls Ivanka 'a mini Donald', Eric a 'moron' in new secret audio
item.description: On Friday Mary L. Trump released new secretly recorded conversations with her aunt Maryanne Trump Barry, who is Donald Trump's older sister, where she bashed the family.

item.title: How post-lockdown Strictly Come Dancing will still sparkle with social distancing
item.description: Strictly Come Dancing rehearsals have started, the dancers are pre-recording big numbers, and they are quarantining in a hotel in Elstree, Herts, before the official launch in late September.

item.title: Tears, tantrums and tragedies below deck: SIAN BOYLE exposes the seedy reality of superyachts
item.description: SIAN BOYLE: Below Deck was a sleeper hit on America's Bravo network until this 'Caribbean Sea version of Downton Abbey', as one critic called it, launched here several weeks ago.

item.title: Rebekah Vardy steps out after 'filing papers FORCING Coleen Rooney into court'
item.description: The WAG, 38, kept it casual as she stepped out alone in London on Friday after reportedly signing legal papers in a bid to get Coleen Rooney to head to court 'immediately' amid their ongoing WAG war.

item.title: Mother and daughters transform the rubbish and dog poo-filled garden of their new home for £450
item.description: Kelly Jones, a mother-of-three and school lunchtime assistant, from Oldham, moved into a new house and was horrified with the mess in the garden she inherited, which has now been transformed.

item.title: Chadwick Boseman: How he became a megastar while battling colon cancer
item.description: Boseman, 43, was diagnosed with stage III colon cancer in 2016. But the actor never publicly discussed his condition and continued to work on major Hollywood films.

item.title: Fresh crisis for Boohoo as audits of 18 factories suggest workers are paid as little as £3-an-hour
item.description: Online retailer Boohoo has been hit with a fresh crisis after audit reports claimed that some workers in at least 18 of the company's supplier factories in Leicester have been paid below minimum wage.

item.title: BBC Proms begins with music by black British composer 'exploring themes of identity'
item.description: The world premiere of Hannah Kendall's five-minute Tuxedo: Vasco 'de' Gama opened the programme on BBC Two tonight at the Royal Albert Hall in London.

item.title: BBC chief Lord Hall says broadcaster can embark on a 'big push' to move more staff out of London
item.description: Lord Tony Hall - who will be replaced by Tim Davie on September 1 - said 70 per cent of BBC staff could be placed outside of London. ' The BBC already has several offices across the UK.

item.title: More than HALF of Britons have struggled to get a GP appointment since Covid hit UK
item.description: A stunning 53 per cent of Britons said they were finding it harder to get an appointment than before the pandemic, a survey by YouGov has revealed. More appointments are being done online.

item.title: How a new generation has taken on these stately homes and given them fresh life
item.description: The National Trust has been criticised for its country houses in recent days, but there are hundreds more (pictured, Hopetoun House) in private ownership who are eager to welcome visitors.

item.title: Backlog of cancer patients awaiting treatment should clear 'within a matter of months'
item.description: Matt Hancock admitted that the number of cancer patients waiting longer than 62 days - the standard the Government wants to see - increased 'substantially' amid lockdown.

item.title: Part-time schools to cause coronavirus childcare chaos next week as breakfast clubs are axed
item.description: Many schools are reopening from next week with shorter school days or reduced hours, causing difficulties for thousands of parents who hope to return to work in offices and factories.

item.title: Bravery medal for hero British Army dog that took out an Al Qaeda sniper
item.description: Kuno (pictured), a Belgian shepherd malinois, was shot several times during the operation at the heavily- fortified terrorist base.

item.title: Jacob Blake was armed with a knife and put one cop in a headlock during fight, police union says
item.description: On Friday, a statement from Brendan Matthews, an attorney for the Kenosha Professional Police Association, alleges that Blake had a knife and 'forcefully fought' with officers.
item.media:description: This undated handout photo provided by the Wisconsin Department of Justice shows Kenosha Police Officer Rusten Sheskey. State authorities identified Sheskey, a seven-year veteran of the Kenosha Police Department, as the officer who shot Jacob Blake. (Wisconsin Department of Justice via AP)

item.title: Elon Musk demonstrates his Neuralink implants brain-machine interface in PIGS
item.description: Elon Musk promised his Neuralink update would 'show neurons firing in real-time' and he kept to his promise Friday during a live demonstration with pigs that were fitted with the Link implant.

item.title: The five most viewed homes online this summer on Rightmove
item.description: While most will not be able to put together enough pennies to snap up the five homes outlined here, there is no harm in dreaming and having a good look from the safe distance of your own home.

item.title: British ex-public schoolboy, 31, left with horrific injuries after being caned in Singapore
item.description: Former British public schoolboy Ye Ming Yuen, 31, was caned 24 times in Singapore for drugs offences. He is now at the centre of a diplomatic row between Britain and Singapore.

item.title: 'It was not a good sight': Trump makes first public comments on Jacob Blake shooting
item.description: Blake, a 29-year-old black father, was shot seven times by police Sunday while they were responding to a domestic incident at a home in Kenosha, Wisconsin.

item.title: Boris Johnson faces collision course with defiant unions as he launches back-to-work drive
item.description: Downing Street sources said the Prime Minister was determined to get 'every' civil servant back to the office to demonstrate a safe return to work is possible.

item.title: Melania Trump called Ivanka a 'snake' and slammed Michelle Obama, according to new book
item.description: Melania Trump scoffed at Michelle Obama and called Ivanka Trump a 'snake', according to a new book by her former best friend and aide Stephanie Winston Wolkoff.

item.title: Paralysed by paranoia: ROBERT HARDMAN says scariest part of ghost town Britain is irrational fears
item.description: The sepulchral gloom suddenly starts to lift as I walk along Gracechurch Street. From round the corner comes a strange, exciting sound seldom heard in the City of London in recent months.

item.title: Trump calls BLM mob who attacked Sen. Rand Paul 'thugs' at New Hampshire rally
item.description: President Trump kicked off his New Hampshire rally on Friday with a rant against the BLM protesters who accosted guests departing his RNC speech at the White House on Thursday night.

item.title: Colombian authorities intercept Mexico-bound narco-sub with $18 million worth of cocaine
item.description: On Sunday. the Colombian National Police and Armed Forces intercepted a submarine transporting 1,055 kilos of cocaine. The shipment was due in Mexico during the first week of September.

item.title: Brad Pitt, 56, met new girlfriend Nicole Poturalski, 27, at her HUSBAND'S restaurant
item.description: Brad Pitt met his stunning new girlfriend Nicole Poturalski at her husband's high-class Berlin restaurant, MailOnline can reveal.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell is the first federal NYC inmate to be allowed in-person visit since the pandemic
item.description: Two members of Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team were spotted visiting her on Friday, making her the first federal inmate in New York City to be granted an in-person visit since the pandemic started.

item.title: YouTuber Landon Clifford was 'addicted to prescription drugs before he hanged himself'
item.description: YouTube star Landon Clifford, 19, reportedly tried to take his own life on August 13 and after six days in a coma was declared brain dead on August 18.

item.title: Audiences return to concerts as 270 people gather for socially distanced orchestral recital in Leeds
item.description: The Orchestra of Opera North and singer Nicholas Watts performed a selection of music by Mozart, Schubert and Mendelssohn at Pilot Event: Live at Leeds Town Hall.

item.title: AMANDA PLATELL salutes heroines from Andrew Harper's widow Lissie to Stephen Lawrence's mother
item.description: AMANDA PLATELL: Just over a year ago it was, that PC Andrew Harper's young bride Lissie received that late-night knock on the door to bring her the news that would blight her life for ever.

item.title: Poll finds those aged 40 to 60 are more 'glass half-full' than younger people
item.description: Researchers analysed polls from US and Netherlands, involving more than 30,000 people, and found mid-lifers were more likely to agree with phrases like 'I expect more good things to happen'.

item.title: New petrol and diesel cars could be banned from 2030 under Government electric vehicle plans
item.description: New petrol and diesel cars could be banned in the UK from as early as 2030 under Government plans to speed up the green transition, it was reported last night.

item.title: Heathrow Airport trials could spare Britons from quarantine after holidays if ministers back scheme
item.description: The airport is working with Oxford and Manchester universities on three cutting-edge tests to screen people on arrival and departure, it was reported last night.

item.title: It's Britain's biggest tomato! Grower, 42, shows off his record 6lb 14oz monster
item.description: Douglas Smith's efforts paid off when he broke the record to grow Britain's biggest tomato, in Stanstead Abbotts, Hertfordshire.

item.title: Men should think twice before reaching for their smartphone at night
item.description: Sperm concentration and their ability to 'swim' were all lower in men who used their phones and tablets at night, scientists found. The researchers obtained sperm samples from 116 men.

item.title: Unseen photographs show Mick Jagger, Keith Richards and co craved middle-class domesticity
item.description: The fan mags demanded pictures of The Rolling Stones in their new domesticity and, rather than let in intrusive Press photographers, they asked their friend Mankowitz to do 'At Home' sessions.

item.title: Half of Cabinet ministers could see a big rise in the number of houses built in their back yards
item.description: Boris Johnson is under pressure from some Tory MPs to ditch the system following concerns that UK greenfield sites will be built on simply because the algorithm claims more homes are needed.

item.title: Just 5% of workers have returned to Business Secretary Alok Sharma's office
item.description: Business Secretary Alok Sharma led calls this week urging firms to get workers back to their desks. But, just 5 per cent of his own department's 1,800 staff arrived at its central London HQ.

item.title: German hospital treating poisoned Putin critic Alexei Navalny has asked for British help
item.description: The German hospital's doctors called upon the Government's world-leading Defence Science and Technology Laboratory as they try to treat the Russian opposition leader.

item.title: Litter pickers battle plastic toys dumped on beaches as they plead to 'leave only footprints'
item.description: Volunteers say the cheap toys, including buckets, spades and frisbees, are increasingly being seen as one-use items to be left behind rather than taken home and saved for another day.

item.title: DR MAX THE MIND DOCTOR: Ban gossiping at the school gates? Never...
item.description: DR MAX THE MIND DOCTOR: I know gossiping can be denounced as malicious, unkind or bitchy. But it's actually what makes us human and helps build a sense of community.

item.title: Ellie Gould's parents reveal their fight for 'Ellie's Law'
item.description: On a warm May Friday afternoon last year, Matthew returned early from work to find his daughter Ellie lying inert in a pool of blood in the kitchen of the family home in Calne, Wiltshire.

item.title: Ben Stokes speaks for the first time after his father, Ged, revealed he is battling brain cancer
item.description: His dad Ged, 64, recently made the heartbreaking revelation after his diagnosis in January following his return home from South Africa - where he was taken seriously ill during the winter.

item.title: Meet Sportsmail's new signing! Micah Richards opens up on battles with racism and punditry
item.description: Micah Richards has earned a place in sporting history thanks to his youthful achievements. The ex-England footballer was 18 when he became the youngest defender to play for the national side.

item.title: Mars Bar 11 years past its sell-by date sells on eBay for £50
item.description: Eli Toy (pictured), 26, found the chocolate bar while deep cleaning the Co-op supermarket where he works in Dundee.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg says Apple has stranglehold on apps
item.description: '[Apple has] this unique stranglehold as a gatekeeper on what gets on phones,' Zuckerberg said in a live video address on Thursday to more than 50,000 Facebook employees.

item.title: Chris Grayling quits Intelligence and Security Committee
item.description: Former Conservative MP Mr Lewis was elected as chairman of the committee ahead of Mr Grayling (pictured), who had been widely tipped for the role, in July.

item.title: One of the highest ranking US intelligence officials shot himself dead in his front yard
item.description: Anthony Ming Schinella, 52, died on June 14 in Arlington, Virginia, but his death had not been widely reported until this week, when his death was revealed to have been a suicide by gun.

item.title: ADHD in teenagers by may be triggered by packaging chemicals
item.description: US experts found associations between attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder-related behaviour and endocrine-disrupting chemicals, especially phthalates.

item.title: Waitrose is trialling grocery deliveries in half an hour after signing deal with Deliveroo
item.description: Waitrose said customers could expect items delivered to their home within as little as half an hour if they live in one of the areas covered by the trial starting on Tuesday.

item.title: Bake Off's Candice Brown slams diner
item.description: Candice Brown, 35, from London , who runs The Green Man in Eversholt, Milton Keynes, has taken to Twitter to slam a diner for demanding she carry on the at Out to Help Out discount.

item.title: Four arrested over Imran Safi abduction of three young boys in Coulsdon
item.description: Met Police said four men aged between 21 and 41 were arrested at a property in Ilford, east London, this morning on suspicion of being involved in the abduction of Bilal, 6, Ebrar, 5, and Yaseen Safi, 3.

item.title: Leaked iPad Air 4 manual reveals Apple's next tablet will have TouchID built into the power key
item.description: The leak originated on the Chinese social media platform Xiahongshu but was shared on Twitter by relatively new Apple leaker DuanRui.

item.title: Haulier pleads GUILTY to manslaughter of Vietnamese migrants
item.description: Haulier Ronan Hughes, 40, of Co Armagh in Northern Ireland, has pleaded guilty at the Old Bailey to the manslaughter of migrants who were found dead in a container in Essex last October.

item.title: 4 in 5 high-risk people taking statins still have high cholesterol
item.description: Researchers from Imperial College London analysed the findings of a major study of cardiovascular patients in 18 European countries including the UK.

item.title: Just 356 fines issued for not wearing face mask on public transport
item.description: The wearing of face coverings on trains and buses has been compulsory in England since June 15.

item.title: PC Andrew Harper: Jailed teenager appeals against sentence
item.description: Henry Long (pictured), 19, was acquitted of murder but admitted manslaughter after PC Andrew Harper was caught in a crane strap attached to the back of a car driven by Long.

item.title: 'Reckless' jet ski lout is blasted by police for racing within inches of a pod of dolphins
item.description: The man came within a few inches of the aquatic mammals in Berry Head before zooming off, with photographs shared by police showing the animals close to his vessel.

item.title: Chelsea mascot who pranked Steven Gerrard in tunnel with handshake snub signs for Billericay Town
item.description: Cast your mind back to February 2006 when Chelsea hosted Liverpool at Stamford Bridge - do you remember that mascot who hilariously pranked Steven Gerrard in the tunnel prior to kick-off?
